intro: Niphobolus angustissimus, commonly known as the slender niphobolus, is a flowering plant native to parts of East Asia. It is a member of the Malvaceae family, which includes hibiscus and cotton. The plant produces small, pale yellow flowers that are typically clustered in inflorescences. Its leaves are simple, ovate, and have a rough texture. It is often found in moist, shaded environments such as forests or along stream banks.
